title: Keyboard Navigation Tab Order: Tab Order on Studio Channel Page Focuses on Hidden Items
body: ## Observed behavior When tabbing through the channel page, the focus changes to elements in the side menu, but unless the user has the menu open, the focus is on items that the user cannot see. The attached screen record shows the focused elements when pressing tab and how there are no focused elements in view until the green checkmark is focused. https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46411498/199113331-9762dfbb-9bd9-4e97-ac68-c5699bb175a9.mov This screenshot displays the current tab order using chrome extension [taba11y](https://accessiblewebsiteservices.com/accessibility-testing-taba11y-chrome-extension/) ## Expected behavior Consistent tab focus on elements the user can see and no focus on hidden elements. ## User-facing consequences Accessibility issue for users that are visually impaired or unable to use a mouse and rely on consistent keyboard navigation. ## Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Log in to Studio 2. On the channels page, with menu closed, press tab to see the order in which elements are focused 3. On the channels page, with menu open, press tab to see the order in which elements are focused ## Usage Details - OS: M1 Mac - Browser: Chrome - URL: https://studio.learningequality.org/en/channels/#/my-channels

title: Unstable - The Duration > Reference option is not enabled for .mp3/.mp4 resources
body:
## Observed behavior
The Duration > Reference option is not enabled for .mp3/.mp4 resources and cannot be selected. The option is active and available for .pdf resources.

## Expected behavior
Enabled Reference option for .mp3/.mp4 resources

## Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Go to https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/en/accounts/#/ and sign in
2. Create a brand new channel and add a resource
3. Attempt to select the Reference option for the Duration drop-down

## Additional information

![2022-08-12_18-34-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79847249/184391286-8daec6f2-9168-4118-a7b9-573a350f6c6c.png)


## Usage Details
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome
 - URL: https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/

title: Unstable - Missing values after copying folders and resources
body:
## Observed behavior
After copying a folder or a resource any values entered for 'Learning activity', 'Level', 'What you will need', 'Tags' and 'Category' are missing.

## Expected behavior
Everything should be copied correctly.

## Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Go to https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/en/accounts/#/ and sign in
2. Create a brand new channel add folder and resources and make sure all the fields are filled in.
3. Copy the folders/resources and compare the copied items to the originals.

## Additional information
![2022-08-12_14-31-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79847249/184356312-477ebf6f-5ab8-4fae-ae88-18a5ca05fc6a.png)

![2022-08-12_14-39-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79847249/184356334-8a614f44-7e69-437d-a061-4bc89c7530c5.png)

## Usage Details
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome
 - URL: https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/

title: Unstable - I'm seeing the 'Contains unpublished resources' icon for resources which I've just published
body:
## Observed behavior
After creating a channel containing a custom created exercise, an uploaded pdf file and some imported folders with resources from Khan Academy I published the channel. To my surprise after having successfully published the channel I kept seeing the  'Contains unpublished resources' icon. Clicking on a folder to see which are the unpublished resources causes the icon to disappear.

## Expected behavior
The icon 'Contains unpublished resources' should not be displayed if all resources are published.

## Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Go to https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/en/accounts/#/ and sign in
2. Create a channel with folders and resources and publish it.
3. Look for the  'Contains unpublished resources' icon

## Additional information
Video:
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79847249/184168870-634c91d2-58da-4bf1-ac21-0b15d419b277.mp4


## Usage Details
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome, Firefox
 - URL: https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/

title: Unstable - The selected chips disappear on their own
body:
## Observed behavior
When creating/editing the details of a folder or a resource the selected chips keep disappearing on their own. This seems valid for all multiselect fields such as 'Learning activity', 'Level', 'What you will need' etc

## Expected behavior
Any selected chips should remain unless removed by the user

## Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Go to https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/en/accounts/#/ and sign in
2. Create a folder or upload a resource and attempt to select several values for the 'Learning activity' field

## Additional information
Video:
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79847249/184155785-9ded9e44-95c9-4465-a8db-946967ab6f05.mp4

## Usage Details
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome, Firefox
 - URL: https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/

title: Unstable - Cannot view the details of an uploaded file or exercise
body:
## Observed behavior
It seems that some of the values selected in the Edit details form of a resource are causing problems resulting in inability to view the details of the resource. 
So far I've definitely encountered this for exercises, .pdf and .mp4 resources.
For a resource of type .mp4 I was able to identify that the issue was caused by having checked any of the accessibility checkboxes such as 'Has audio descriptions' or 'Has sign language captions'

## Expected behavior
The 'View details' option should be fully functional

## Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Go to https://unstable.studio.learningequality.org/en/accounts/#/ and sign in
2. Upload an .mp4 file and fill in all the required fields plus check any of the accessibility checkboxes.
3. Save and go back to the location of the resource within a folder
4. Select the 'View details' option for the .mp4 resource

## Additional information
Video:
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79847249/184152941-6af9ca0b-ecb7-466b-8df3-ec13b99fa864.mp4


title: Questions with resized images published under Spanish or French will break in Kolibri

milestone.title: 2022 Q1-Q2 Phase 1: tasks and backlog
milestone.description: Release milestone focused on task improvements and backlog of bug fixes

body:
## Observed behavior
The templates for rendering the Perseus JSON for assessment items do not escape or jsonify the designated width or height of images, e.g. https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/584aabd988a2867ace00f869553af78ce139a8c8/contentcuration/contentcuration/templates/perseus/multiple_selection.json#L6 (but also true for other question types as well).

This means that in languages that do not use `.` as the decimal separator, and when the width and height of an image are non-integer, the rendered value will break later JSON parsing, as JSON expects `.` separated numbers.

## Expected behavior
Should always output valid JSON regardless of the currently active translation language.


## User-facing consequences
Users publishing their channels when the interface is set to Spanish or French could suffer unpredictable breakages in Kolibri.

title: Investigate/reproduct publishing issue: Editing a content node doesn't trigger updates to be Published
body:
## Observed behavior
Making changes in a content node, like editing a title or description, or adding a thumbnail, doesn't trigger the "Publish" button to appear as it should. In order to activate the publish button, a resource has to be added/deleted.

Reported by UN Women:
> It doesn’t seem possible to update and publish Channel details alone (e.g. upload a new thumbnail, change the description or title) – it seems like you have to delete or add resources within the channel. I changed the Channel thumbnail and edited the description on my Second Chance channel, but the Publish button wasn’t activated. So I had to add a dummy PDF in order to publish those changes and then had to delete the PDF.

## Expected behavior
I would expect to be able to publish updates even when the updates are just edits to an existing content node.

title: I can't stop syncing resources

milestone.title: Post Release Stabilization
milestone.description: Stabilizing behaviour following the release of the new Studio. Fixing regressions in behaviour and errors likely to lead to data loss, unreliability, or complete blocking of the user experience.

body:
## Summary

I can't stop syncing resources. The main cause seems to be that we call [the action to stop publishing](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/hotfixes/contentcuration/contentcuration/frontend/channelEdit/views/progress/ProgressModal.vue#L209) for both publishing and syncing process. [This place](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/hotfixes/contentcuration/contentcuration/frontend/channelEdit/views/progress/ProgressModal.vue#L204) also needs to be fixed in the same way.

## How to reproduce

1. Navigate to the channel editor
2. Open the context menu (...) next to "Publish"
3. Select "Sync resources"
4. Select some values to be synced and proceed to syncing
5. Try to stop syncing
6. After confirming "Yes, stop task", the task is still running and the modal window stays visible

## Screenshots

![Peek 2021-02-16 13-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/108061601-d94bf980-7058-11eb-9f78-834b25283183.gif)

## Real-life consequences

Users can't stop sync action and they can't navigate out of the modal (it's possible only by page reload)

body:
## Summary
We need to handle connectivity issues and other non-authentication errors better during login and signup.  Currently they are being wrongly presented as authentication issues.

This misleading behavior effects users in low connectivity settings.

![screenshot ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/389782/107673141-52afaa80-6c5b-11eb-8643-38cb7cae1665.png)

Steps to resolve this:
- [ ] Add an offline status indicator to login/signup pages to provide feedback if a user is experiencing connectivity issues
- [ ] Add some less misleading feedback for when someone tries to log in or sign up the midst of connectivity issues

Select one: BUG

title: Channel language field is required but the error validation does not prevent creating a new channel if not provided

milestone.title: Post Release Stabilization
milestone.description: Stabilizing behaviour following the release of the new Studio. Fixing regressions in behaviour and errors likely to lead to data loss, unreliability, or complete blocking of the user experience.

body:
## Summary

I am not sure if it's a regression or not, and we don't (yet) have error validation described in the [Gherkin scenario](https://www.notion.so/learningequality/Channel-list-8dc9e41dc08445f7ac983cb27ce943f9#05c6a07623a8417b96d128b3f6fa81b3) (cc @metodimilevqa), but atm user is able to create a new channel by just providing the title and clicking the <kbd>Create</kbd> button, just to immediately see the :exclamation: error icon hovering over the `Edit` (pencil) button.

Maybe the error validation at first beat takes the first (default) option in the language selector (`аҧсуа (ab)`; which is Abkhaz language, TIL :slightly_smiling_face:) as good, and allows the user to click the <kbd>Create</kbd> button, and only flashes the validation error message **after**, when it's too late  (see the recording below).

This forces the user to go back and edit channel details to set the chosen language in order to correct the error. 

## Category

BUG

## Usage Details

- https://hotfixes.studio.learningequality.org/ and `master`
- Browser: both Chrome & FF on Ubuntu 20.04
- Channel: new
- Topic/Content Item: -

## Traceback or relevant snippet from browser console

Nothing in the console or network tab.

## How to reproduce

1. Create a new channel
2. Enter just the channel name and 
3. Observe the error icon

If we don't want to disable the <kbd>Create</kbd> button until the values for all the required fields are entered (which I usually favor, but might involve changing other elements and validation workflow), validation of the *Language* field should occur together with the *Channel name* field, and trigger the error notification **before** allowing the user to successfully click the <kbd>Create</kbd> button. 

```
Feature: Create a new channel

	Background: 
		Given that I am signed in on the system
			And that I am on the *My Channels* tab

	Scenario: Create a new channel 
		When I click the *New channel* button
		Then I see the *New channel* page
		When I enter channel name <channel_name>
			And I enter channel description <channel_description>
			And I select a language <language>
			And I upload the image file as a channel thumbnail 
			And I click the *Create* button
		Then the page reloads
			And I am on the <channel_name> channel edit page

	Scenario: Error validation
		Given that I am on the *New channel* page
		When click the *Create* button
			But I did not enter anything in the fields
		Then I see that the focus is returned to the *Channel name* field
			And I see the error notification *Field is required* for *Channel name*
			And I also see the error notification *Field is required* for *Language*
		# discard the previous channel and create a new one from the beginning
		When I enter channel name <channel_name>
			But I don't select the <language>
			And I click the *Create* button
		Then I see that the focus is returned to the *Language* field
			And I see the error notification *Field is required* for *Language*
		# discard the previous channel and create a new one from the beginning
		When I select the <language>
			But I don't enter channel name <channel_name>
			And I click the *Create* button
		Then I see that the focus is returned to the *Channel name* field
			And I see the error notification *Field is required* for *Channel name*
		When I enter channel name <channel_name>
		Then the page reloads
			And I am on the <channel_name> channel edit page

Examples:
| channel_name  | channel_description  | language |
| ck-12         | sample channel       | English  | 
```


## Screenshots

![language-error-validation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1457929/106530639-02af4600-64ed-11eb-88f9-7dcde55c1be8.gif)


## Real-life consequences

Current workflow forces the user to open the *Edit channel details* page and select the language.

title: Async task completes but status remains pending
body:
## Summary
*Seems to happen inconsistently, on develop server*

On the develop studio server, I initiated an import from another channel, which queued a `duplicate-nodes` task. After waiting for a while (at least 15 minutes), the task polling response was still showing that the task status was `PENDING`. Upon further inspection, the task metadata had data which indicated the task had actually completed, but the status did not reflect it.


## Category

BUG

## Usage Details

 - Browser: Chrome 87.0.4280.88
 - Channel: https://develop.studio.learningequality.org/en/channels/30b9311f6b39401a86f62abe860ab400
 - Topic/Content Item: Copied African Storybook `Acholi` topic

## Traceback or relevant snippet from browser console
The task API response:
```
[
  {
    "task_id": "1a7b0d68e1eb48cdafd0b1b488df6eda",
    "task_type": "duplicate-nodes",
    "created": "2020-12-07T17:28:52.350822Z",
    "status": "PENDING",
    "is_progress_tracking": true,
    "metadata": {
      "result": {
        "changes": [
          {
            "key": "0ad96fe6ff6640c6b79a9ea3a643fe76",
            "mods": {
              "__COPYING": false
            },
            "type": 2,
            "table": "contentnode"
          }
        ]
      },
      "affects": {
        "channel": "30b9311f6b39401a86f62abe860ab400"
      },
      "progress": 100
    },
    "user": 2512,
    "channel": "30b9311f6b39401a86f62abe860ab400"
  }
]
```

## How to reproduce

1. Open a channel on develop
2. Click ADD
3. Select Import from another channel
4. Select a channel and topic
5. Finish import
6. The copied topic will remain in copying state until page refresh

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)
The user can refresh the page as a workaround but there isn't any indication whether the copy has finished and therefore if refreshing would show the copy as complete.

title: Mastery model m and n values can be lost on updates
body:
## Summary

When I remove the `n` value, `MasteryDropdown` emits an `input` event with the `m` value set to `0` too, even when it wasn't empty before.

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce

There are more ways of how to reproduce, this seems to be the simplest one. See comments for a more complicated scenario.

1. Add a new exercise to a channel, set its mastery criteria to "M of N..." and submit `m` and `n` values, for example:

![Screenshot_2020-12-03 Kolibri Studio](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/101040117-54366580-357c-11eb-92e4-b66bf3041eec.png)

2. Remove `n` value (`5` in this example) and inspect the payload of the emitted `input` event

![Screenshot from 2020-12-03 15-33-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/101042314-5816b780-357d-11eb-9890-7f768837706d.png)

### Expected

The payload should be:

```
m: 2
n: 0
```

## Comments

Together with lots of async stuff happening in `DetailsTabView` when updating values, I suspect that this issue and some unhappy timing might be the cause of the problems described in #2575 because when I remove `n` like described above and type a new value, let's say 6, there are two `input` events emitted, one with the payload `m:0, n:0` and shortly after that another one with payload `m:2, n:6`.

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end-users)

Might be the cause (or at least one of them) of #2575.

title: Clicking on the search button resets previous user selections
body:
## Summary

Clicking on the search button resets the channels selection the user has done


## Category

BUG

## Usage Details

Editing a channel, when importing from other channels we have a search interface. If the user selects a channel type before clicking on the search button the UI forgets the selection the user did and forces the search on the whole content library (which is usually a bad selection in performance terms)


## Screenshots

![search2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1008178/97903925-11485e80-1d40-11eb-9727-b9a8d27bb642.gif)

title: Sync changes before leaving the app
body:
## Summary

Updates are currently saved to IndexedDB that is periodically synced with backend.

Sync should be triggered immediately when leaving the app (logout, closing a tab). This operation might take a while to finish so users should be informed about it and given an option to wait for changes to be propagated before they leave. We also need to communicate when sync error occurs durign this time. There are two types of errors - validation errors and unexpected errors.

## Category

BUG

## Screenshots

![Selection_001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/97147306-9e504e00-1769-11eb-9c39-8e5d724de56f.png)

## Expected

title: Flickering or invalid cursor while dragging
body:
**This depends on integration of draggable into clipboard to completely resolve**

## Summary
The Draggable components use the browser's [Drag and Drop HTML5 API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTML_Drag_and_Drop_API). On drag events, there is a [`DataTransfer` object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer) which has two fields which control the browser's UX reactions to dragging, for example the cursor response to different areas. The two fields are `dropEffect` and `effectAllowed`. These need to be kept up-to-date as drag events occur over different elements.

The effects relevant to our use cases are `move`, `copy`, and `none`. The `move` effect should be allowed when moving items in the topic view. The `copy` effect should be allowed to and from the clipboard. Finally, the `none` effect should occur when dragging over a region not in the same universe, or when dragging over an item that is not allowed to be dropped upon (dragging parent topic into it's own descendant).

@jayoshih Has reported always seeing the not-allowed cursor while dragging.

## Category

INCOMPLETE-ENHANCEMENT BUG

## How to reproduce

1. Drag an element
2. Observe the cursor switching between many different types without moving

title: Complete field follow-ups
body:
## Summary

1. Investigate, fix and add tests for [an issue described here](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/pull/2328#discussion_r503980778):

![Selection_001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/96749501-33022700-13cb-11eb-88c3-32750a59cb97.png)

2. Add a basic test suite to every place that builds on `complete` field to get more confidence as currently, client is the only entity responsible for marking a node as `complete`

3. Rename `validate...` functions (e.g. `validateNodeMasteryModel`) to `get...Errors` (e.g. `getNodeMasteryModelErrors`. Current naming has shown to be very confusing

4. Add type checks and warnings for developers to `isNodeComplete` function to make clear that it needs to receive a complete information about a node. For example, if we want the function to check if an exercise is complete, we need to provide its assessment items (if we forget, `complete` will be evaluated to `false` even if the node is complete). Therefore, let's throw a warning if a node is an exercise but `assessmentItems` property is `undefined`. Prepare similar checks for files.

title: Page reload breaks circular dependencies checks when adding previous/next steps
body:
## Summary

Currently, it's not allowed to create immediate or distant circular dependencies in previous/next steps chains. "Add previous steps" and "Add next steps" pages get broken on page reload in this regard.
 
Might be related to https://github.com/learningequality/studio/pull/2363#pullrequestreview-501798858

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce

1. Clear IndexedDB and run `yarn run devsetup`

The following chain [will be prepared](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/develop/contentcuration/contentcuration/management/commands/setup.py#L145):

```
Sample Video -> Sample Document -> Sample Exercise -> Sample Audio -> Sample HTML
```

2. Visit "Related" tab of edit modal for "Sample Video" node
3. Click "Add previous step" and you'll see correct UI:
![Selection_001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/95566977-9a5ec500-0a22-11eb-867b-8dca3f0924d6.png)

4. Reload the page
5. UI is broken and I can add "Sample Audio", "Sample HTML" and "Sample Exercise" to previous steps which is not allowed because they're already next steps:

![Selection_002](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/95567102-c2e6bf00-0a22-11eb-8ef9-e8b0520b255e.png)

title: "Saving..." indicator is not displayed for certain assessment editor actions
body:
## Summary

Although `/api/sync` call seems to be triggered with a correct payload when updating an exercise, "Saving..." text with a loader in the bottom bar is not displayed. This seems to be happening for most of (most likely for all) operations available (adding new questions, answers, and hints, editing the text of questions, answers, and hints, reordering, removing, ... ).

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce

1. Before running devserver, run "yarn run devsetup" if you haven't done so already to have test data available.
2. Login as user "a@a.com", password: "a"
3. Click "Published Channel" on "My channels" list, and you'll be redirected to the channel editor page.
4. Navigate to "Sample Exercise" in "Topic 1"
5. Click "Edit details" in the context menu or in the panel on the right that will be displayed after you click on the exercise
6. Navigate to "Questions" tab in the exercise edit modal
7. Edit the exercise. For example, choose a question and edit its text.
8. There is no "Saving..." indicator in the right bottom corner

![Selection_001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/97166467-97cfcf80-1785-11eb-840f-63e6ce1c24db.png)

## Expected

There should be "Saving..." indicator (like when you edit an exercise title in "Details" tab):

![Selection_002](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13509191/97166422-84246900-1785-11eb-9607-3ec2def1c06c.png)

## Real-life consequences

- Users don't know if their updates are being saved
- Inconsistent behavior in terms of the whole edit modal

body:

After deleting the db, the left view matches the staging tree, but the right view matches the main tree contents still.

title: Different variable names for different values
body:
## Description

You can move nodes now. A variable was named `changes` was turning our expected object into an empty array.

However, it does not fix the fact that moves are not triggering the call to sync. They're in the respective `*changes*` tables.

#### Issue Addressed (if applicable)

Fixes https://github.com/learningequality/studio/issues/2339

## Steps to Test

Move a node then in your dev tools console call `window.forceServerSync()` and then see that the move has happened as expected.

title: Accepted invites not shown as invites on ChannelList anymore
body:
## Description

A few issues surrounding invitations on the frontend - each commit fixes a separate issue.

- Only show a person once in the channel edit -> share page. Previously an invited user would show as invited still even after accepting
- Exclude accepted invites from channel list. I was seeing previously accepted invites showing up on page reload - but this may be due to https://github.com/learningequality/studio/issues/2347 - in any case - now we'll not show any invites to the user if they're accepted.
- We were overriding given information by setting `accepted` and `declined` as false between reading from state and displaying to the user so state would not be reflected properly.

#### Issue Addressed (if applicable)

Fixes https://github.com/learningequality/studio/issues/2067

## Steps to Test

- Make invites, accept them and test that the above are no longer issues.

title: Invites are deleted as expected, but then replaced by a copy of itself
body:
## Summary

When someone is invited to a channel, we make a `contentcuration_invitaitions` entry.

When that invitation is accepted, we give the proper user permissions per the invitation and then we delete the row we created in `contentcuration_invitations`.

That works as it should.

But then - the exact same invitation is created anew. I cannot figure out why and it makes me sad.

```
/* Here we delete the invited person from the channel_viewers table */

2020-10-01 06:34:14.025 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: DELETE FROM "contentcuration_channel_viewers" WHERE ("contentcuration_channel_viewers"."channel_id" = '0399d2f6f4dd4e48ad167a9390648d30' AND "contentcuration_channel_viewers"."user_id" IN (8))


/* Get editor user id... */

2020-10-01 06:34:14.026 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: COMMIT
2020-10-01 06:34:14.027 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: BEGIN
2020-10-01 06:34:14.028 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: SELECT "contentcuration_channel_editors"."user_id" FROM "contentcuration_channel_editors" WHERE ("contentcuration_channel_editors"."channel_id" = '0399d2f6f4dd4e48ad167a9390648d30' AND "contentcuration_channel_editors"."user_id" IN (8))

/* Here we delete the invitation we accepted! */

2020-10-01 06:34:14.028 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: COMMIT
2020-10-01 06:34:14.029 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: BEGIN
2020-10-01 06:34:14.029 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: DELETE FROM "contentcuration_invitation" WHERE "contentcuration_invitation"."id" IN ('f121eee11f1b4958b58ee0ac0ee3b82e')

/* Here we for some reason make a new one milliseconds after we deleted! */

2020-10-01 06:34:14.029 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: COMMIT
2020-10-01 06:34:14.031 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: BEGIN
2020-10-01 06:34:14.032 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: UPDATE "contentcuration_invitation" SET "invited_id" = 8, "share_mode" = 'edit', "email" = 'ivanbot@leq.org', "sender_id" = 1, "channel_id" = '0399d2f6f4dd4e48ad167a9390648d30', "first_name" = 'Ivan', "last_name" = 'NeoBot' WHERE "contentcuration_invitation"."id" = '771ef13ada6a4b6db5f05540a4c3770f'

2020-10-01 06:34:14.032 PDT [18645] learningequality@kolibri-studio LOG:  statement: INSERT INTO "contentcuration_invitation" ("id", "invited_id", "share_mode", "email", "sender_id", "channel_id", "first_name", "last_name") VALUES ('771ef13ada6a4b6db5f05540a4c3770f', 8, 'edit', 'ivanbot@leq.org', 1, '0399d2f6f4dd4e48ad167a9390648d30', 'Ivan', 'NeoBot')
```

## How to reproduce

1. Make an account and make a channel then invite another account.
2. Go to that account in incognito (or same browser just clear your indexed db) and accept the invitation.

`invitation.py` is where we define the ViewSet and Serializer for invitations. In the `Serializer#update()` method we delete the instance. I feel like something in here or in the Invitation model has to be the culprit. Possibly some kind of `onDelete` hooks/callbacks on the Inivtation or some related model?

title: 412 Precondition Failed /api/contentnode & State inconsistencies
body:
## Summary

I encountered this issue two ways but can only replicate one, I will share both. In both cases, I receive the following error message:

`412 GET .../api/contentnode?parent=abcdef1234567890 {"detail":"No valid filter parameters supplied"}`

Additionally, it appears that moving content nodes occurs properly somewhere in our state, but our NodePanel view does not accurately retrieve the updated data when the state changes. More on this in the replication notes below.

So - in summary - I think there are two issues that appear to be related, but perhaps are not?

1. Moved/copied nodes are not being reflected properly in NodePanel
2. Attempts to get content nodes for moved/copied nodes fails server-side. I wonder whether this is related to failures to sync to the server. If contentnode only requires `parent` - then the ID being passed is considered invalid which I assume could also mean non-existent (eg, we never synced the copy/move outcome from client to server, but we go to the server for the data rather than from within the client scope). If the contentnode API endpoint requires a field other than `parent` then it is clear that we need to make sure that is included on the call. 

__EDIT:__ I did a bit of digging and item 2 above is definitely caused by the outstanding issues with syncing. The backend returns nodes with a `total_count: 0` even if that node has children client-side. I'm not sure if we should be relying on data we get from the backend if that data ought to be responsive in relation to other resources. We could write front-end functions that care about the front-end's state first and foremost. It doesn't appear that `total_count` is used on the backend for logic or calculations and may have been added for use on the client side only. @rtibbles notes that there is imminent work to improve the queryset annotation for fields like `total_count` - so that ought to resolve this and several other issues.

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce

_Topic A, Topic B, etc are just generics to refer to the same topics in the context._

__Reliably__

1. Add Topic A to your clipboard.
2. Move Topic A to be a child of Topic B.
3. Click "Go to location" in the snackbar message
4. See the 412 in your network tab in devtools.

Additionally, you may note that if you go and move Topic C into Topic B that you will see Topic A in the "Move content nodes" modal. You may also see Topic A in the left sidebar TreeView reflected correctly as a child of Topic B. 

@rtibbles noted that this may be related to some aspect of our getters' reactivity - maybe a good lead to start with.

__Less reliably__

1. Duplicate / Make a copy (don't use the clipboard, use the 'Make a copy' feature) of Topic A - which should result in a new topic in the same location called something like "Copy of Topic A". 
2. Enter that new "Copy of Topic A" folder and see the 412 error.

This only happened to me once though, the first reproduction steps are more reliable.

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

Fundamental features of Studio's channel edit do not work as expected or intended with regard to moving and copying nodes.

title: Clipboard Issues - Node Deletion UX, Unintended consequences of clicking a button
body:
## Summary

__I strikethroughed some issues that were listed here and fixed and moved them to the bottom. There is still a bug here and a proposal.__

3. Clicking the context menu button on a topic in the clipboard toggles the topic being open / closed (showing its children or not) when it should only toggle the opening of the context menu.

And one optional suggestion:

4. The context menu icon ought to be permanently visible and not only on hover. Why hide functionality from the user when it's inoffensive and not in the way?

---

__Fixed__

1. ~Deleting from the clipboard does not remove it from the view immediately. Snackbar comes up and says "Deleted..." but it stays there until you refresh.~
2. ~Items that you are deleting ought to be disabled during the deletion process. You can still click to select children even when their parent node is selected. Selecting a parent node ought to select all of its children and likewise for deselection. It may be worth considering just disabling the whole drawer until we're done doing the deletion - not sure if starting multiple large deletions before the previous finishes could cause issues. In either case - any visual "Hey we're working on it" indicator and blocking the ability to seemingly change things while deleting would be great. And to pile on just a little bit more - maybe we ought to do the same for moving nodes to/from the clipboard.~ __This isn't an issue anymore after @rtibbles made clipboard deletion so fast__

title: Error during file upload leads to sync errors
body:
## Summary

When you attempt to upload a file, and it fails for whatever reason, it appears the ContentNode gets created, but the `/api/sync` operation, so it continues to try the operation from scratch, including re-creating the node. This leads to an 
validation error message in the return data: 

```
                "id": [
                    "Topic with this id already exists."
                ]
``` 

This causes the sync call itself to return a 400 error, preventing the call from completing.

## How to reproduce

1. Upload a file in a way that fails (sorry, don't know an easy way to reproduce except introducing an error into file upload code)
2. Wait for sync to error.

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

Problems saving data to the server.

title: Data are not refreshed on channel root tree page reload
body:
## Summary

When I reload channel root tree edit page (`TreeView`), no request to fetch data is made, even when [`loadChannel`](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/develop/contentcuration/contentcuration/frontend/shared/vuex/channel/actions.js#L18) is [properly called](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/develop/contentcuration/contentcuration/frontend/channelEdit/router.js#L117).

That causes major bugs in some workflows, e.g.:
1. After the successful import of content to a channel, [imported content is not displayed](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/pull/1994#pullrequestreview-456521591).
2. When a channel has a new staging tree, a bar with a review prompt is not displayed after the page refresh (@ivanistheone implemented a notification that can help us in some cases, but it's not sufficient for all use-cases, more information [here](https://github.com/MisRob/studio/pull/1#issuecomment-662421939))

IndexedDB needs to be cleaned and page reloaded for updates to be displayed.

We might need to check the rest of the pages as well. All data should be up-to-date after a full page reload without the need to remove IndexedDB.

title: View mode not set back to default
body:
## Summary

View mode is not set back to default when resource preview panel is closed after clicking on two different resources.

After brief investigation it seems that update of [`SET_VIEW_MODE` and `SET_VIEW_MODE_OVERRIDES`](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/vue-refactor/contentcuration/contentcuration/frontend/channelEdit/mutations.js) will be needed to check if `state.viewMode` and `state.viewModeOverrides` already contains items with ids that should be newly saved so we don't have duplicates there.

If there's a need to save more view modes (not sure about all planned use-cases), it might be good to also update [`isCompactViewMode` getter](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/vue-refactor/contentcuration/contentcuration/frontend/channelEdit/getters.js) to work with ids.

5. Close resource preview panel on the right

## Current behavior

View mode stays compact.

## Expected behavior

View mode should be switched back to default.

title: Do not treat assessment items based on their `assessment_id` only
body:
## Summary

There are duplicate assessment ids in database after running `yarn run devsetup`.

Example: `assessment_id: 03438e0d3823481fbd2c9e28811c12c2` ("What color is the sky") same for both content nodes `152d58fbfecb451da74ec3263009c397` and `350924774a1543649175a3f7e6bdab4b`

```
          contentnode_id          |          assessment_id           |                            question                            
----------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------
 152d58fbfecb451da74ec3263009c397 | 03438e0d3823481fbd2c9e28811c12c2 | What color is the sky
 152d58fbfecb451da74ec3263009c397 | cd124b6116ac43519d08c502a87b49f1 | Which equations add up to $$\frac{2^3}{\surd\overline{16}}$$ ?
 152d58fbfecb451da74ec3263009c397 | f1e99ec2650945bc8da0d5213be55391 | Hot pink is a color in the rainbow
 152d58fbfecb451da74ec3263009c397 | 1947cf354dcb40929b4f05e00855832a | 3+5=?
 28957ee14c804ee5a5b639add7feef5e | ab6132c38c6c49e592aaf7654219c57b | What color is the sky
 28957ee14c804ee5a5b639add7feef5e | c5bf832dd9414a49bfd45a8aa5637c87 | Which equations add up to $$\frac{2^3}{\surd\overline{16}}$$ ?
 28957ee14c804ee5a5b639add7feef5e | 2c55f44ec8084611bdfa92bff572c553 | Hot pink is a color in the rainbow
 28957ee14c804ee5a5b639add7feef5e | d8c675b24ef140d0a6b2984b7ba85fa4 | 3+5=?
 350924774a1543649175a3f7e6bdab4b | 1947cf354dcb40929b4f05e00855832a | 3+5=?
 350924774a1543649175a3f7e6bdab4b | f1e99ec2650945bc8da0d5213be55391 | Hot pink is a color in the rainbow
 350924774a1543649175a3f7e6bdab4b | cd124b6116ac43519d08c502a87b49f1 | Which equations add up to $$\frac{2^3}{\surd\overline{16}}$$ ?
 350924774a1543649175a3f7e6bdab4b | 03438e0d3823481fbd2c9e28811c12c2 | What color is the sky

```

This causes assessment items update calls to `/api/sync` on `vue-refactor` to fail on `400 Bad Request` in local dev env because [this recently introduced check doesn't succeed](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/vue-refactor/contentcuration/contentcuration/viewsets/base.py#L174). Though it seems to me that the check makes sense and I suppose that we should rather prevent from having duplicate assessment ids? They seem to be created during [duplication of node](https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/vue-refactor/contentcuration/contentcuration/management/commands/setup.py#L130). I've decided to open an issue for this to make sure that we check this issue as a whole as I've encountered it by chance and suppose that duplicate assessment ids might cause problems at another places.

## How to reproduce

1. Checkout `vue-refactor` (might not be necessary but I've discovered the issue there and there are some assessment items prepared as test data)
2. Login to PostrgreSQL `sudo su postgres`, `psql`
3. Remove "kolibri-studio" local dev database `postgres=# DROP DATABASE "kolibri-studio";`
4. Create a new database `postgres=# CREATE DATABASE "kolibri-studio" WITH TEMPLATE = template0 ENCODING = "UTF8" OWNER = "learningequality";`
5. `yarn run devsetup`
6. `postgres=# \c "kolibri-studio";`
7. `kolibri-studio=# SELECT contentnode_id, assessment_id, question FROM contentcuration_assessmentitem;`:

title: Exercise creation usability issues
body:
## Summary

@laurenlichtman recently created some exercises, and when we were discussing about it, she gave me some feedback on some issues she ran into. I thought it would be good to file these, so we don't lose track of them. (Some may already be addressed by the Vue migration as well.) Here are her comments: 

(1) it’s really hard to tell how the image will look within questions until it’s rendered.

(2) I would drag and drop an image, but it would load it in the whole browser (maybe I dropped incorrectly), and then when refreshing, I would lose all of the work I hadn’t saved. So that happened twice for a few questions that I had to re-do.

(3) It’d be helpful if you had a list of answers, and you entered them in, if they would be one answer per line (like the same way if you do a google form, and enter in many individual lines, it appears as different answers). (When I asked her to clarify this comment, she said that she'd like to be able to paste multiple answers in at once, and have Studio use line breaks to separate them into multiple answers.)

title: Files in old staging trees not removed and count towards space limits
body:
## Summary

After doing several runs of a chef I was working on, I started getting out of disk space errors. I have this set to a smaller value locally as I don't want to fill up my hard drive. 

Upon inspection, I found that nearly all of my storage space was filled by files from old runs of the chef, which were in the garbage tree. 

Also note that it looks like we don't delete the actual file at any point, which means that actual storage usage will only ever grow, no matter how many files have actually been deleted. 

## How to reproduce

1. Run a sushi chef, then make a change that generates new files and run it again.

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

Users will run out of space

title: Drag/drop sort order not getting saved
body:
## Summary

When I tried alphabetizing my items, I had to keep refreshing to check that the sort order was correct

## Category

Select one: BUG

## Usage Details

 - Channel: https://develop.studio.learningequality.org/channels/cb126e8a34404b7685ce727968673a9b/edit/dc1a6ec

## How to reproduce

1. Try alphabetizing items in topic above in ascending or descending order (vary between moving individual and multiple items at a time)
2. Refresh the page

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

Drag/drop gets really frustrating to use



# Issue report

1st issue
Need to press refresh F5/ Ctr R after every action in order to save the move of the files. If I do more than 2 actions and press Ctr R the second action will reverse Files will revert to original places. Only the first move will remain.
(This is making my progress incredibly slow and frustrating)

Steps:
1. Move files to clipboard. Select files to move by ticking the boxes on the left. Drag files to Clipboard (files move successfully every time.
2. Select files to move back into the same channel. Drag files to the location. Files move and can be seen in the correct place in the channel. (Files move successfully every time).
3. Go back and select different files to move. Repeat process.
4. Click Ctrl R or F5 (have tried both).
5. Whatever files that were selected and moved in the first move will remain after refresh. The rest will revert to original place.

2nd issue
No files will stay in the place that I relocate them to even if I press Ctrl R.
This time they do not revert back to their original place but go to the very end of the list.
Even if I do just one file at a time the files will not stay where I put them.

Steps:
1. Move files to clipboard. Select files to move by ticking the boxes on the left. Drag files to Clipboard. Files move successfully every time.
2. Select files to move back into the same channel. Drag files to the location. Files move and can be seen in the correct place in the channel (files move successfully every time).
3. Click Ctrl R or F5 (have tried both)
4. Files move to the bottom of the list. (Not their original place)

title: Delete nodes can still time out
body:
## Summary

Delete nodes still runs as a sync operation, and can give timeout errors. We should move this operation to async tasks, and see if we can improve performance by always deleting from the trash.

## Category

BUG

title: In certain cases move operations do not trigger progress dialogs
body:
## Summary

Quoting Blaine's bug bash report:

Move from clipboard does not show progress modal. Also, move from three-dot menu on topic does not show progress modal.
1) Add multiple items to clipboard, from two channels 2) Open another channel 3) Open clipboard and “select all” 4) Click “Move” and select current channel 5) Observe task API calls but no progress modal

## Category

BUG

title: Pending tasks don't block channel from edits
body:
## Summary

If you start a long-running task, but it doesn't start immediately due to a pending queue of tasks, you can continue to edit the channel until the task actually starts.

We should probably treat pending tasks the same as started tasks, and block editing unless the task is canceled.

We should also clearly identify that the task is in a queued state to the user, and be clear that it may be a while before the operation starts.

## Category

BUG

title: Node permission checks fail for clipboard nodes
body:
## Summary

#1456 added permission checks for accessing and editing nodes. It checks for permissions against the node's channel, but in the case of the clipboard, it doesn't belong to any channels. 

We should add a check or filter to make sure that any nodes that belong to the clipboard tree are not part of the channel permissions check.

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce

1. Load the channel edit page, and watch for console errors caused by attempts to load clipboard nodes.

title: Some Celery errors are not caught by task handling
body:
## Summary

Certain Celery worker errors appear not to result in the task being marked as failed. Due to this, we don't update the task state to report the error and the UI appears 'hung'.

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce

2. Start a Celery task from the UI

Result: Worker throws error but frontend state is not updated.

title: Error creating thumbnails for certain formats
body:
When creating thumbnails, we pass in the filename of a NamedTemporaryFile. However, as the default behavior is to delete the file when closed, and we close it before attempting to generate the thumbnail image, we get an error since the temp file no longer exists.

Suggested fix: Add the delete=False parameter to NamedTemporaryFile for tempf, and delete the temp file manually. We should also make sure we do the cleanup even if an error occurs.

Note also that the same NamedTemporaryFile / tempf.close() pattern appears in other thumbnail generation code, so those methods should probably have the same fix applied.

Also, it would be great if we could get some thumbnail generation tests!

Sentry Issue: [STUDIO-FF](https://sentry.io/learningequality/studio/issues/754402605/)

title: Slow performance can lead to unexpected UI state
body:
## Summary

During the Studio bug hunt on Oct 26th, one common factor in many of the issues that cropped up was that the UI state did not match the backend state. This often was due to the fact that backend operations were slow, and the frontend either did not notify the user it was still working, or it timed out and only showed the changes the user made some time later.

## Category

BUG

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

If the user is not aware the backend is still working on their change, or they have been notified that the request timed out, they will likely assume the change was not made properly and retry the operation multiple times. This could lead to the state later on appearing incorrect.

title: content_id must be changed when the content of a ContentNode changes
body:
Based on feedback here:
_Originally posted by @jayoshih in https://github.com/learningequality/studio/pull/970#issuecomment-428031986_

It seems that we may not be generating a new `content_id` when the content of an exercise gets changed from the ContentNode that it was copied from. This is necessary, as otherwise we will have identified these nodes as identical in terms of their content, even though their content is not the same.

title: Reports of disappearing content
body:
## Summary

We have received two separate reports of content seemingly disappearing. Specifically, when they import content (from KA in reported cases), after a period of time all the nodes with actual content are gone, leaving only the empty topic and subtopic nodes. 

In one instance, it was reported that the content appeared to come back, but we have not yet confirmed that all the contents have been saved to the server. This problem appears to be transient. 

We have no record that the content was ever saved to the server - daily backups have only ever shown the empty topic structures, though this does not mean the data did not exist on the server for some short time. At least one of the users has subsequently been able to upload content, meaning the problem isn't constant.

We know the problem has occurred with Chrome, so it is likely not a browser compatibility issue, but we haven't determined if it is specific to a particular OS.

Our best working theory right now is that there may be some sort of save problem that is not getting caught by the front-end properly, and the front-end continues to display the unsaved data as if it had been saved. Then, eventually, with a refresh of the page or other change, it 'disappears'. However, we have been unable to reproduce this issue so far. 

It's possible that unreliable internet connections may be a factor.

It is important for us to try and find some way of reproducing this problem, perhaps including simulating an unreliable internet connection somehow. (Maybe Dummynet? https://packetu.com/2014/01/01/building-bad-network-dummynet/)

## Category

BUG

## Usage Details

*Please give details about how you were using Studio.*

 - Browser: ?
 - Channel: ?
 - Topic/Content Item: ?

```
INSERT TRACEBACK, LOG MESSAGES ETC. HERE
```

```
node = TopicNode(title="ﺭﻮﺑﻮﺗ ﻊﻟﻯ ﺶﻜﻟ ﻊﻨﻜﺑﻮﺗ ﻲﺣﺍﺮﺑ ﻒﻳ ﻢﻋﺍﺮﻛ ﺈﻔﺗﺭﺎﻀﻳﺓ!"+RTL+" ("+RTL+" ﻒﻳﺪ    ﻳﻭ )"+RTL,
    source_id="a")
```

has one bracket facing the same way as the other if RTL is an empty string, but not if `RTL="\u200F"`.

## Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1030130/46821489-b6babf00-cd80-11e8-8a87-809fefce7f00.png)

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)
Only affects Studio, not Kolibri proper.
May affect other text boxes.

title: Email links are non-HTTPS (force SSL?)
body:
## Summary

When for instance inviting someone to a channel, the link should be HTTPS, otherwise one is redirected to a non-HTTPS page for logging in.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/374612/46310878-e3bce400-c5c0-11e8-998a-a5d7e9f3db23.png)

Fix 1: Change the HTTP server configuration to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS. This might be dangerous because we have some HTTP-only traffic for channel downloads?

Fix 2: Add an HTTPS setting to force the protocol of URLs in emails. We can use `request.is_secure()` while sending emails, but then we are also relying on a request object, which is only relevant in views.

See:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/topics/security/#ssl-https


## Category

Security

title: Removing languages we don't have frontend translations for.
body:
## Description

Allows Django to handle fallbacks for each message (built-in feature).

#### Issue Addressed (if applicable)

Resolves #405 

## Steps to Test

- [ ] Change browser language to a spanish other than Mexican
- [ ] Open studio
- [ ] Ensure that the page is in spanish
- [ ] Change browser language to Mexican spanish
- [ ] Ensure that the page is _still_ in spanish

## Implementation Notes (optional)

Killed off a few languages, including pirate english :disappointed: sorry y'all.

Django has language fallback features that automatically update the code returned in `get_language` - if a regional version of the language isn't found, it'll fall back to the next closest thing (non-regional, then some other region).

#### Does this introduce any tech-debt items?

Not that I know of, but this is why I included @jayoshih 

## Additional Comments
Please verify asap so that I can get the points for the bug bash :smile:

title: Studio should validate AssessmentItem answers on load and save

milestone.title: Studio: next major release
milestone.description: The next major release coinciding with Kolibri 0.16 release

body:
## Summary

Currently, the Studio UI expects for the data it receives to be valid and complete, but we are not validating answer data upon load or save.

In general, we need to be explicitly validating JSONFields in order to ensure that invalid data does not get saved to the database through a bug or other means.

This problem has led to issues #879 and #892, and could lead to more issues in the future until it is addressed.

## Category

BUG

title: If a node is cloned, and then the original is deleted, operations on clone may fail
body:
## Summary

When a node is cloned, it makes a reference to the original node. If the original node it is pointing to is then deleted, the database will throw errors due to cloned_source pointing to a non-existent node. To resolve this, we should make sure that upon delete a node removes any references to itself in other nodes.

## Category

BUG

## Usage Details

*Please give details about how you were using Studio.*

 - Browser: ?
 - Channel: ?
 - Topic/Content Item: ?

## Traceback or relevant snippet from browser console

```
INSERT TRACEBACK, LOG MESSAGES ETC. HERE
```

## How to reproduce

1. Clone a ContentNode
2. Delete the original
3. Try to delete the clone

You will get an error about an integrity violation with the cloned_source_id foreign key.

title: Docker installation does not work
body:
## Summary

Following the instructions at https://github.com/learningequality/studio/blob/develop/README.md
`docker-compose up` should make an easy installation of Studio but it does not work properly, the studio-app container has not the system complete.

## Category
 BUG 

## Usage Details

docker-compose uses Dockerfile.dev which:
1. Does not do `yarn install`
2. Even after runing manually `yarn install `, problems continue: It has a not working entry point because it uses
`devserver` which runs in parallel, among other, `services` . services should not be run inside this container as they are in their own containers.
3. Studio uses `django-s3-storage` not `django-storage`. Some of the parameters in the settings.py file are not valid in django-s3-storage. It's important `AWS_AUTO_CREATE_BUCKET` is not valid, so after installation the bucket needs to be created or the steps described in the above mentioned README.md won't work.

title: Invalid zip file uploads but causes 500 error on preview
body:
## Summary

If a user uploads an invalid zip file, it uploads and gets added fine, but throws a 500 error when attempting to preview.

It should at least provide a user-friendly error message so that the user / curator has some idea of what happened.

## Category

BUG

## Traceback or relevant snippet from browser console

https://console.cloud.google.com/errors/CMz50ez1iKPIiwE?time=P30D&project=contentworkshop-159920

## How to reproduce

1. Copy a non-zip file and change it's extension to .zip (or use a corrupt zip if you have one)
2. Upload the file to Studio
3. Fill out metadata then preview the file.

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

If curator does not preview, an invalid / corrupt zip could into the final package. If they do preview, they may think Studio is unable to read the zip rather than realize the zip itself has an issue.

title: published sqlite databases aren't up to date for some channels
body:
## Summary

@jamalex noticed that for quite a few channels, the version in Studio was different from the sqlite database available for import to Kolibri:

> For GDL: http://studio.learningequality.org/content/databases/0e173fca6e9052f8a474a2fb84055faf.sqlite3 is version 2, but here it's 3: https://studio.learningequality.org/api/public/v1/channels/lookup/0e173fca6e9052f8a474a2fb84055faf
For AS: http://studio.learningequality.org/content/databases/f9d3e0e46ea25789bbed672ff6a399ed.sqlite3 is version 16, but here it's 17: https://studio.learningequality.org/api/public/v1/channels/lookup/f9d3e0e46ea25789bbed672ff6a399ed (edited)
For PhET: http://studio.learningequality.org/content/databases/197934f144305350b5820c7c4dd8e194.sqlite3 is version 6, but here it's 7: https://studio.learningequality.org/api/public/v1/channels/lookup/197934f144305350b5820c7c4dd8e194

When he tried manually creating a channel and publishing several updates, this wasn't an issue, so maybe it's only an issue for Ricecooker channels?

## Category

BUG

## How to reproduce
It seems that this can be reproduced by publishing an update to a Ricecooker channel, then attempting to upgrade that channel in Kolibri.

## Real-life consequences

Kolibri users are prompted to, but cannot successfully update channels to the latest version.

Channel metadata is out of sync with published sqlite database.

title: It's possible for a channel editor to remove themselves as an editor
body:
## Summary

I don't think this is possible on the UI, but I noticed that I can remove myself as an editor from my own channel via the Browseable API e.g.

by picking a random email on the "editors" form control. Unless I know this person, I can't regain access to my own Channel.

1. Create a channel
2. View the channel on the browseable API
3. Pick email(s) that are not yours on the "editors" field
4. Update it by clicking "PUT"
5. Lose access to your channel.

Make a change to the channel settings of a channel and attempt to re-publish 

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

If I want to add a thumbnail and description later, I can't publish these updates unless I also make some changes to the content

title: Invitation of collaborators on a channel fails to go through for aliases
body:
## Summary

Upon invitation to a channel, users do not receive access if the invitation is sent to an email alias, versus the original email address. Example screenshot below.

## Cateogry

Select one: BUG | ENHANCEMENT | QUESTION | OTHER (describe)

## Usage Details

*Please give details in how were you using the Content Curation Server.*

 - Browser: Chrome
 - Channel: Mi Canal de Formadores
 - Topic/Content Item: n/a

## Traceback or relevant snippet from browser console

```
INSERT TRACEBACK, LOG MESSAGES ETC. HERE
```

## How to reproduce

1. Create channel
2. Invite collaborators
3. Invite using email addresses which point to the same account, but are different addresses
4. Confusion when collaborators log in to see they don't have access to the channel.

## Screenshots

*If applicable*
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5150483/29938355-567b3382-8e3d-11e7-9281-1139e9af09a7.png)

## Real-life consequences (anything community should be aware of, for instance how it affects end users)

Confusion resulted during a training session whereby collaborators who used an alias (and didn't realize it was an alias) didn't receive the invitation.

body:
## Summary

-Preview for video doesn't work for videos on the SMLA-School content channel. Video is downloadable from channel and uncorrupted when played on local media player.
-Spot checking reveals this issue is only applicable to the first two videos in this topic folder ('Mathematics') with many other videos previewing fine.
-Spot checking in other topic folder such as 'Basic Science' reveals same issue.

## Cateogry

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5150483/27359969-93b55d88-55d3-11e7-9d0b-9f3b8c1e23ad.png)

Content curators without access to Kolibri  pre-release won't have any other way of previewing their content.

title: Content size not reported correctly during import from other channels
body:
## Summary

**Counting small numbers** subtopic size is reported to be 279Mb, when in fact it should only be around 15Mb. 

## Cateogry

- [x] Bug
- [ ] Enhancement
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other (describe)

## Usage Details

 - Browser: all
 - Channel: Khan Academy (en)
 - Topic/Content Item: Counting small numbers

## How to reproduce

1. Make a new channel or open an existing one.
2. Try to import **Counting small numbers** from **Khan Academy (en) > Math > Early math > Counting**.
3. Observe the total size at the bottom of the modal.

## Screenshots

![kolibri studio - google chrome_194](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1457929/25579618/acafb65c-2e79-11e7-92d2-908c4ec4e188.png)

* The other two topics in this sample channel are empty, and cannot account for the reported size error.

## Real-life consequences

Content curators cannot gauge the correct size of the topics they are importing.
